items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible in the evening of Monday the 28th June.
Heavy rainfall in East Devon has caused river levels to rise rapidly. 
Flooding is expected from 7pm on Monday. We expect flooding to affect low lying land in the floodplain and roads close to the river in the following areas Seaton, Colyton, Axminster and Axmouth.
Further showery rain is forecast through until Tuesday. River levels are expected to remain higher than normal throughout this period. Please take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels.  We will update this message when the situation changes

This Flood Alert has been removed. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Occasional showery rainfall is forecast for Tuesday, 29/06/2021, though conditions should be mainly dry. We continue to monitor the situation. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high but are now falling on the River Kennet. Therefore, the risk of flooding of low lying roads and farmland remains, especially in the Knighton area. Further outbreaks of rain are forecast today. Wednesday is forecast to be mostly dry. We expect river levels to remain high, but continue to fall, over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels, avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  
This message will be updated tomorrow 30/06/2021, or earlier if the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue the alert if necessary. 

Further rainfall is forecast with isolated heavy showers this afternoon. We continue to monitor the situation and are checking the condition of any defences. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the ‘River and Sea levels in England’ Webpage for current river levels.

Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for mostly dry conditions today, Tuesday 29th June, but with the chance of some showery outbreaks of rain. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

The Eastern Yar remains high and continues to rise. Main road flooding is affecting Langbridge, Alverstone and Golf Links Road. Water is very close to property at Langbridge and Alverstone. The river has risen for longer than expected, but the rate of rise is slowing. At Alverstone, the river should peak by 18:30, rising by another 1 to 2 cm.  However, showers are still possible this evening. Given that the river is so high and has not had a chance to lower, only a small amount of rain will cause property flooding. We are monitoring this very closely.  Should rain affect the river this evening, we may issue a Flood Warning. At Sandown the river won’t peak until the early hours of tomorrow morning (30/06/21). Property flooding is not currently expected in this location.  We have lowered Bembridge sluice. In Alverstone, pumps used to protect property will need to operate. In Langbridge, please also take action to ensure you can protect your property, should further rain fall this evening.  This message will be updated by 10:00 on 30/06/21, or sooner if the situation changes.

items.description: River Axe (Upper) from Winsham to Axminster, including Chard Junction and Weycroft
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
River levels are now dropping below levels of concern for property flooding. Further showers are forecast for this afternoon and tomorrow, but are expected to be of lower intensity than yesterday evening’s rain and river levels are not currently forecast to respond.
The Flood Alert for the River Axe will remain in force until later today.

items.description: River Isle from Chard Reservoir to Hambridge
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed.  
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. Occasional showery rainfall is forecast for Tuesday, 29/06/2021, though conditions should be mainly dry.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

The Western Rother at Lodsbridge and Fittleworth is falling from the elevated level that it reached after Monday’s heavy rain. It will be back closer to its normal level by early evening today, Tuesday 29 June 2021, following a largely rain-free morning. A small amount of rain is possible today Tuesday 29/6/2021 but this will not be significant and the overall forecast is for dry days Wednesday to Friday. At Iping, Stedham and Midhurst river levels have already fallen back down towards their level before Monday’s heavy rain and will fall further today. We will continue to monitor the levels and the forecast and take operational actions where required.

The water level in the Monktonmead Brook remains high, but it is now falling. Some showers are forecast this morning, but the rest of the day should remain dry. Throughout the day (Tuesday 29/06/2021), the water level will continue to fall, and it should return to normal from 12:00 this afternoon.

items.description: Rivers on the Isle of Sheppey
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
River levels have risen as a result of heavy rainfall this afternoon. We expect flooding to affect areas close to the river in Minster. No further heavy rainfall is forecast for today 29/06/2021. We expect river levels to remain high this evening as a result of tide locking. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required.

Please remain aware of your local situation. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 30/06/2021, or as the situation changes.
